skill.name: Ensembl Database
skill.description: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant analysis, comparative genomics, orthologs, VEP predictions, for genomic research.
skill.summary: Access and query the Ensembl genome database for vertebrate genomic data across 250+ species
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: All 145 static findings are false positives. External_command alerts are markdown code fences. Network alerts are legitimate API calls to EMBL-EBI. Cobalt Strike keywords are GA4GH Beacon API references. This is a legitimate bioinformatics tool with no malicious intent.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at SKILL.md:41
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Markdown code fence delimiter for Python syntax highlighting, not actual Ruby/shell backtick execution. Pattern matches ```python in documentation.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at references/api_endpoints.md:6
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Markdown code fence for API endpoint examples. Line contains base URL documentation with markdown formatting, not command execution.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [CRITICAL] blocker: Cobalt Strike keywords at references/api_endpoints.md:295
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: References GA4GH Beacon API endpoint for genomic variant queries. 'Beacon' is a legitimate genomics data sharing protocol standard, not Cobalt Strike malware.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm at scripts/ensembl_query.py:317
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Line contains argparse description text for a CLI help argument, not cryptographic code. Scanner incorrectly matched 'hash' in help text.
CLI argument description for sequence retrieval. Standard bioinformatics option documentation, not system reconnaissance.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [LOW] network: HTTP client library at scripts/ensembl_query.py:50
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Legitimate use of requests library to query https://rest.ensembl.org (official EMBL-EBI genomic database API). No credential theft or data exfiltration.
Hardcoded URL is https://rest.ensembl.org, the official Ensembl REST API endpoint maintained by EMBL-EBI. Legitimate public API target.

content.value_statement: Query the Ensembl genome database REST API for vertebrate genomic data. Look up genes, retrieve sequences, analyze variants with VEP, and perform comparative genomics across 250+ species.
actual_capabilities: Look up gene information by symbol or Ensembl ID for 250+ species
Retrieve DNA, transcript, and protein sequences from genomic databases
Analyze genetic variants using the Variant Effect Predictor (VEP)
Find orthologs and paralogs across species for comparative genomics
Convert coordinates between genome assemblies (GRCh37 to GRCh38)
Query regulatory features and phenotype associations
limitations: Rate limited to 15 requests per second for anonymous users
Only queries Ensembl REST API; does not access local databases
Returns raw API responses; downstream analysis requires additional processing

use_cases.title: Gene Annotation Pipeline
use_cases.description: Look up genes, retrieve transcripts, get protein sequences, find orthologs, and export results for analysis.

use_cases.title: Variant Analysis
use_cases.description: Query variants by rsID, predict functional consequences with VEP, check population frequencies, retrieve phenotype associations.

use_cases.title: Comparative Genomics
use_cases.description: Find orthologs across species, retrieve sequences, compare gene structures, analyze evolutionary conservation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Gene Lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up the gene TP53 in human using Ensembl and return its Ensembl ID, chromosomal location, and description.

prompt_templates.title: Sequence Retrieval
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve the DNA sequence for the BRCA2 gene (ENSG00000139618) in FASTA format.

prompt_templates.title: Variant Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the variant rs699 using VEP and show its predicted consequences and population frequencies.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-Species Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all mouse orthologs for human gene BRCA2 and show their Ensembl IDs and sequence similarity.

output_examples.input: Look up the gene BRCA2 in human

best_practices: Respect the 15 requests per second rate limit for anonymous users
Use batch endpoints when querying multiple items to improve efficiency
Cache frequently accessed data to reduce API calls
anti_patterns: Making sequential single requests instead of using batch endpoints
Ignoring rate limit responses (429 status codes)
Not specifying the correct assembly (GRCh37 vs GRCh38) for coordinate queries

faq.question: What species are supported?
faq.answer: Ensembl covers 250+ vertebrate species including human, mouse, zebrafish, and fruit fly.

faq.question: How do I handle rate limits?
faq.answer: Implement retry logic with the Retry-After header. Maximum 15 requests per second for anonymous users.

faq.question: What is VEP?
faq.answer: Variant Effect Predictor analyzes genetic variants and predicts their functional consequences on genes and proteins.

faq.question: How do I query older genome assemblies?
faq.answer: Use https://grch37.rest.ensembl.org for GRCh37/hg19 queries. Current assemblies use https://rest.ensembl.org.

faq.question: Can I batch multiple queries?
faq.answer: Yes, use POST endpoints with JSON arrays to query multiple IDs in a single request.

faq.question: What output formats are available?
faq.answer: Most endpoints support JSON, FASTA for sequences, and some support XML or plain text.
